name: Wacky Races
overview: The Wacky Races are back in action! It’s the return of Dick Dastardly, Muttley, Penelope Pitstop, Peter Perfect, and the Gruesome Twosome. New characters are introduced in this incarnation as well such as; I.Q. Ickly, Brick Crashman, P.T. Barnstorm, and Pandora Pitstop.

episodes.name: Ya Win Some, Ya Luge Some
episodes.overview: The Racers participate in the Wacky Winter Games. The games culminate in a final competition where Dastardly and Muttley do a very disturbing ice-skating dance.

episodes.name: Mambo Itali-Go-Go
episodes.overview: Racers try to race across the idyllic Tuscan countryside, where they discover that too much hospitality isn't always a good thing.

episodes.name: So Far to Mardi Gras
episodes.overview: The Wackies, joined by guest racer Pandora Pitstop, race customized watercrafts through the Louisiana Swamps.

episodes.name: Easter Express
episodes.overview: The residents of Easter Island celebrate an ancient festival with a Wacky Race. The Racers end up awakening a giant alien menace that awakes the slumbering Easter Island statues.

episodes.name: Race-a-Lot
episodes.overview: Medieval Camelot has never been so exciting, or so wacky!

episodes.name: Peter Imperfect
episodes.overview: After Peter loses his mojo, he just can't seem to regain his cool.

episodes.name: Yes, We Canyon
episodes.overview: Yes, We Canyon. On vacation, the Racers competitive attitudes overwhelm each other and they end up destroying the Grand Canyon.

episodes.name: Roamin' Racers
episodes.overview: Our racers take the roles of ancient Roman chariot racers during the very wacky version of the Roman Games.

episodes.name: Smokey and the Racers
episodes.overview: The Racers race through the American Deep South until they run afoul of Dastardly's cousin, Sheriff Longarm D. Lawe; captured, the Racers are sentenced to 847 years in the local jail and must find a way to escape and finish the race.

episodes.name: Raceketeers
episodes.overview: Penelope, Peter, Tiny, Bella take the roles of the Three Musketeers in a wacky and action packed version of The Man in the Iron Mask.

episodes.name: Fantastic Race
episodes.overview: Shrunk to microscopic size the Racers are accidentally injected by Dastardly and must race through his circulatory system, avoiding his white blood cells, to find a way out before they enlarge inside him.

episodes.name: Space Race
episodes.overview: A thousand years in the future, the Wacky Races are alive and well, and even wackier!

episodes.name: Backseat Drivers
episodes.overview: Racers have always been curious about the mysterious Doombuggy, in which the Gruesome Twosome apparently live in the trunk. The Racers sneak inside and find themselves trapped in a gigantic Halloween wonderland and pursued by familiar monsters.

episodes.name: It's a Wacky Life
episodes.overview: During a Wacky Races Christmas party, Dastardly triggers his latest tricks and finds himself in Heaven reviewing his past misdeeds with a familiar angel named Melvin.

episodes.name: Dashing Thru the Snow
episodes.overview: During a race to the North Pole, the racers accidentally run over Santa Claus and now must take his place to save Christmas.

episodes.name: Cold Rush
episodes.overview: Before a race to the South Pole, Peter challenges Dastardly to win just one race fair and square.

episodes.name: Off Track
episodes.overview: Peter and his friends race back to Peter's hometown of Perfectville and find it wasn't so perfect after all.

episodes.name: Cave Racers
episodes.overview: A trip back in time reveals the very first Wacky Race.

episodes.name: Guru My Dreams
episodes.overview: With the help of a very unusual spiritual adviser, the Racers find themselves racing through their collective unconscious dream world encountering their fondest fantasies, or in the case of Dastardly, a deeply screwed up mess of a psyche.

episodes.name: Pretzel Logic
episodes.overview: Dastardly's Bavarian cousin Desdemona captures the Racers during a competition over the Alps and locks them in her pretzel mines. Are our racers doomed to dig salty snacks forever or can Penelope save the boys from a high carb fate?

episodes.name: Formula Racing
episodes.overview: The Racers are turned into babies and Dastardly is stuck as their babysitter. Babies or not, the need for speed is an undeniable urge, much to Dastardly's regret.

episodes.name: Unraceable
episodes.overview: Dastardly is banned by race owner P.T. Barnstorm from racing for habitual and dangerous cheating. Dastardly is forced to go to an employment agency and take a number of other jobs, all of which he is comically unsuited for.

episodes.name: Sister, Twister
episodes.overview: Pandora switches places with her twin sister Penny in order to steal a prize for good sportsmanship and fair play. But short tempered Pandora has trouble keeping up the pretense of being her unflappably good natured sister.

episodes.name: Mars Need Racers
episodes.overview: P.T. Barnstorm's latest money making race event sends the racers off to race on Mars against an evil space tyrant with Earth as the prize.

episodes.name: Race to the Bottom
episodes.overview: As the race continues through the center of the earth to the Land That Time Forgot, the Racers are attacked by dinosaurs but are rescued at the last second by a tribe of Mole People that crown Muttley King.

episodes.name: Do Over Dastardly
episodes.overview: An experimental time machine gives Dastardly the ability to rewind time 30 seconds at a time. But what good is time travel if you are the one Racer who refuses to learn from his mistakes?

episodes.name: Race Against Time
episodes.overview: I.Q. has been secretly working on a time machine to make time and the Racers cars go faster. It backfires and brings future versions of our Racers back to advise their younger selves.

episodes.name: My Fair Tiny
episodes.overview: Tiny receives an invitation to speak at his old high school. Tiny doesn't want to go because he won't fit in well at Miss Prissy Prisswell's Finishing School for Young Ladies, Gentlemen and Others.

episodes.name: Under the Rainbow
episodes.overview: A raucous race across the Emerald Isle runs afoul of a clan of Leprechauns determined to protect their Pot O' Gold.

episodes.name: Mother Drives Best
episodes.overview: At an annual race where their mothers accompany each of the Racers, their maternal relationship is painfully explored until the moms get caught up in the race and leave our Racers in the dust.

episodes.name: Swap Meet
episodes.overview: As the Racers zoom through the blue grass hills of Kentucky, another one of I.Q.'s inventions begins randomly exchanging the Racer's personalities.

episodes.name: Wacky Spaces
episodes.overview: The future is not what it used to be. As the crew of Wacky One find out when the Evil Lord Dastarius challenges them to a race for the Heart of the Galaxy.

episodes.name: Perils of Peter Perfect
episodes.overview: Peter is kidnapped during a race and the team swings into wacky action to save him.

episodes.name: People Who Need Purple
episodes.overview: In order to win more races, Dastardly creates evil clone versions of the other Racers. Unfortunately, they all have his personality.

episodes.name: Race to Infinity
episodes.overview: In the far future, brave if not too bright, space ranger Peter Perfect entrusts the secret location to the galaxy's greatest weapon to speeder racer, Penelope Spacestop. But can she and her android friends keep evil Lord Dastarius from finding it and conquering the universe?

episodes.name: His Way or the Highway
episodes.overview: A Bollywood musical romp through the old Indian city.

episodes.name: Racer Roundup
episodes.overview: A western themed race ends up to be more than our Racers bargained for.

episodes.name: Grandfather Knows Dast
episodes.overview: Under pressure from his father to finally win at least one race, Dastardly pulls out all the stops with a barrage of tricks and traps. They all backfire so Penelope convinces the other Racers to let Dastardly win.

episodes.name: 40 Yard Dash
episodes.overview: To celebrate their 40th race, the races attempt their shortest easiest race yet. Surely nothing could keep them from actually finishing this race. Could it?

episodes.name: Hong Kong Screwy
episodes.overview: The Racers meet up with guest star Hong Kong Phooey during a thrilling adventure in China.

episodes.name: Dickie and the Race-onauts
episodes.overview: In the Ancient time of legendary heroes, the Wacky Races race to find the golden fleece before the terrible Pluto (Dastardly) and Cerberus (Muttley) do.

episodes.name: Uncle Dickie's Happy Sunshine Children's Hour
episodes.overview: To improve his terrible image, Dick Dastardly is forced to host a morning pre-school kiddie show with the help of his friends.

episodes.name: Peter 2.0
episodes.overview: When Hollywood lures Peter away to a life of fame and fortune, he is replaced on the Wacky Races by an insane, but very handsome robot.

episodes.name: Little Pink Riding Hood
episodes.overview: The Racers zoom through an Enchanted Forest on the way to Grannie's House with the help of guest Racer, Winsome Witch.

episodes.name: Punky Races
episodes.overview: To celebrate the Queen's Golden Jubilee, our Victorian Racers compete using the latest in steam-powered automotive vehicles, until Dickie reveals his plan to take over 19th century England by queen-napping Victoria.

episodes.name: Ragnarok & Roll
episodes.overview: Thor, God of Thunder, challenges a crazed team of berserker Viking Racers to sail across the dangerous sea and discover America. Which they do, when they can be troubled to stop smiting everything they see.

episodes.name: Wacklantis
episodes.overview: The Racers are shanghaied by the King of the underwater city of Atlantis to race his vain and spoiled son through the depths of the Marianas Trench.

episodes.name: Game On
episodes.overview: Pandora traps the team in their own video game, where the only way to escape is to win.

episodes.name: Signed, Sealed and Wacky
episodes.overview: When evil penguins capture Santa Claus, the Racers are recruited by Mrs. Claus to save him.

episodes.name: Wacky Races, The Movie
episodes.overview: A movie executive from Wacky Brothers Studios hires the team to star in a big budget action-filled movie version of their adventures - complete with zombies, mutant vampires, aliens, and even worse - Hollywood writers and directors.

episodes.name: Much Ado About Wacky
episodes.overview: In the most cultured episode of the Wacky Races ever, Dick Dastardly devotes an entire show to acting out the works of William Shakespeare with the help of the other Racers.

episodes.name: Far and Away in Old Bombay
episodes.overview: In a homage to Bollywood musicals, the Wacky Races zoom through Mumbai in an effort to bring two star-crossed lovers from feuding families together.

episodes.name: The Wacky Always Races Twice
episodes.overview: Hard boiled 1930's private detective Bad Penny Pitstop is hired to track down Peter's stolen lunchbox in a race against Dastardly and the Gruesome Twosome.

episodes.name: Mummy Madness
episodes.overview: A race through the Sahara Desert to the Pyramids of Giza leads the Racers to uncover ancient aliens' plot to conquer the world.

episodes.name: King Solomon's Races
episodes.overview: Deep in the heart of Africa, the Racers and guest racer Pandora Pitstop, get trapped in the labyrinthine and trap laden mines of King Solomon.

episodes.name: The Trial of Dick Dastardly
episodes.overview: After Dastardly's cheating goes too far, he is banished from the Wacky Races by the creators of the original show. His friends do their best to defend him before a jury of the worst cartoon villains ever.

episodes.name: The Wack Stuff
episodes.overview: Penelope is kidnapped by aliens and forced to compete in a space race against strange but oddly familiar aliens, and only Space Ghost can save us all.

episodes.name: Dog Gone Dastardly
episodes.overview: When a bolt of lighting rewires Dastardly's brain so everyone he sees looks like Muttley, the Racers must dare to travel to the most horrible, dangerous, despicable, awful place in the universe, Dastardly's mind.

episodes.name: The Purple Ray from Outer Space
episodes.overview: In a homage to 1930's space adventures, brave two-fisted American hero Peter Perfect and his friends takes a trip to Pluto to stop the evil space emperor Dastardly from conquering the Earth.

episodes.name: The Attack of the Mega-Muttley
episodes.overview: During a race through Japan, another of Dastardly's schemes gone wrong causes Muttley to grow into a giant monster and attack Downtown Tokyo. With IQ's help, the Racers build a super-cool mega mech to take on the rampaging pooch.

episodes.name: Wackier Than Fiction
episodes.overview: The Racers find themselves in Storyland, with all the greatest characters of fiction, where they struggle to prove they are real people (and not badly written cartoon characters) so they can return to reality.

episodes.name: Never Too Old To Wacky
episodes.overview: When IQ accidentally ages the Racers into their 80s, they are retired to a elder care storage facility in Florida, where the Racers prove you are never too old to cause complete wacky chaos.

episodes.name: Wacky Wizards
episodes.overview: The evil wizard Lord Dast enlists his army of flying Muttleys to steal a powerful pendant from the good-natured Penelope Peasant. With the help of the other Racers, Penelope embarks on a quest to save their magical world.

episodes.name: Super Wacky
episodes.overview: The super-city of Wackopolis is thrown into peril when the supervillain Purple Puppeteer executes a foul scheme to outlaw the city's heroes. Can the Super Racers stop him?

episodes.name: Wack to the Future
episodes.overview: When the future version of Dastardly returns from the future to alter history, the Racers and our Dastardly battle to reset time and save the world.

episodes.name: Catastrophe
episodes.overview: Dastardly's penchant for cat-based weaponry and traps finally cat-ches up with him when he is transported into a distant future world ruled entirely by cats.

episodes.name: Brains Before Brawn
episodes.overview: Tiny's creator returns to town with a special gift, the missing half of Tiny's brain! When his newfound intelligence goes straight to his head, the racers grow tired of his arrogant attitude and team up to steal back his brain.

episodes.name: Double the Dastardly
episodes.overview: In 1903 Manhattan, famed newspaper mogul I.Q. Fuzzleberry pits the racers against each other in a contest promising one hundred dollars to the first man, or woman, to reach the moon.

episodes.name: Wackyland
episodes.overview: The Racers are invited to the grand opening of Wackyland, the world's first racing-themed amusement park! But when Peter disappears, the Racers uncover a sinister plot brewing under the park.

episodes.name: Curses, Foiled Again
episodes.overview: After Dastardly finally wins a race with a bout of particularly nasty tricks, he is "awarded" a cursed idol that torments him endlessly with terrible luck despite his stubborn denial of its powers.

episodes.name: Double Trouble
episodes.overview: Dastardly meets the one and only member of his fan club, a six year old girl. But when she turns out to be even nastier and more deceitful than he is, he challenges her to a race to prove that he's the best cheater there is.

episodes.name: Slow and Steady
episodes.overview: In a twist on the classic Tortoise and the Hare fable, the racers take on guest star Huckleberry Hound in a romp through the Appalachian Mountains.

episodes.name: The Scarlet Pinkernel
episodes.overview: Our racers star as the Lords and Lady's of Enlightenment-era England as they entertain themselves with a challenge to sneak off to France and smuggle a French aristocrat back to London as a spot of sporting fun.

episodes.name: Troy and Troy Again
episodes.overview: Brick Crashman retells the classic story of the wacky and fun-filled Trojan War staring the Racers as the ancient heroes of Homer's Iliad.

episodes.name: What a Wacky Development This Is
episodes.overview: In a bid to attract more fans to the show, a Wacky Network executive convinces the racers to change the show's format to attract a younger, hipper audience.

episodes.name: I, Race Car
episodes.overview: Dastardly's ill fated attempt to upgrade the Mean Machine accidentally causes all the race cars to gain self awareness and free will.
